content: ETF DBS Vickers Securities Investments Asked by Gabriel ChanAsked on 04 Apr 2019On DBS Vickers, is there anyway to buy the S&P 500 ETF? Is SPDR S&P 500 ETF S27 the only option? How does this different from buying in the NYSE?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 05 Apr 2019If you only want to trade sgx listed counters then S27 is your only option. If dbs vickers allow you to access other markets, consider SPY in the US market, or the Irish domiciled equivalents available through LSE. The latter had less withholding fees for dividend payouts as compared to the former. You may also want to check out this previous question posted here on seedly https://seedly.sg/questions/investing-into-irish-domiciled-s-p-500-etfHope this helps0 comments1
